intro: Ptiloria scabrella, commonly known as the rough ptiloria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Ptiloria scabrella is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
